data.title: Typescript 2.0.6 breaks formatter
data.body:
Builds fail with:

```
/Users/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode/extensions/configuration-editing/src/extension.ts is not formatted
/Users/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode/extensions/extension-editing/src/extension.ts is not formatted
/Users/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode/extensions/javascript/src/javascriptMain.ts is not formatted
/Users/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode/extensions/markdown/src/extension.ts is not formatted
...
```

This occurs on all our files.

Additionally, the `monaco.d.ts` that gets generated and formatted by the TypeScript version we have installed has no whitespace indentation at all.

data.body: Code completion in Rails projects.

data.title: Consider snippets for launch.json
data.body:
Testing #13585

Right now if you want to add an additional debug configuration, you need to copy and paste an existing config. We should consider adding a couple snippets to make it easier to get started with adding an additional configuration via simple code completions.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/19715150/1603de68-9b08-11e6-9c8f-c2bcab633066.png)

data.title: Update launch.json header text
"sourceMaps" and "outFiles" configurations should be added if *.ts file exists, even if not open
data.body:
Testing #13585

I find it strange to have the default behavior predicated on a file being open or not. Is there a reason outFiles and sourceMaps is only added when a *.ts file is open, rather than a *.ts file exists outside of node_modules?

data.title: Consider highlighting "program" line in launch.json after creating default configuration

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #13585

I've found that this is where users tend to struggle the most when setting up launch configurations, and it may help to simply position the cursor in the right place so that the line stands out a little more. So after the file is created, it would look more like this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/19715724/047615e0-9b0c-11e6-9dc8-0f665ef45c9a.png)

data.title: Should not generate "sourceMaps" and "outFiles" configs in launch.json for *.d.ts files
data.body:
Testing #13585

*.d.ts files could exist for purely tooling purposes, so we should filter those out when selecting default debug configs.

data.title: Keep open all opened files
data.body:
Feature request.

Add settings to allow keep open all opened files open (even unmodifyed ones), right now it is necessary to click keep open menu item explicitly, really inconvenient. 
Please add setting for it, Most of the time when I open some file I want to keep it open even if not edit it, not vice versa.

data.title: vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('') does not return defaults
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.7.0-insider (1.7.0-insider) (`2016-10-25T06:03:02.884Z`)
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan

_**vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('') does not return default values for configuration items defined in `package.json` of an extension.**_

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Invoking `vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('python');`, only returns the values found in workspace `settings.json`
2. However this same code running on VS Code (`1.6`) returns from `settings.json` merged with the default configuration values defined in `package.json`

This is the value returned in VS Code Insiders:

``` json
{
    "pythonPath":"${workspaceRoot}/p27/bin/python"
}
```

This is the value returned in VS Code 1.6:

``` json
{
    "pythonPath": "${workspaceRoot}/p27/bin/python",
    "sortImports": {
        "args": [
            "-sp",
            "${workspaceRoot}/issues/sorts"
        ]
    },
    "linting": {
        "enabled": true,
        "prospectorEnabled": false,
        "pylintEnabled": true,
        "pep8Enabled": false,
        "flake8Enabled": false,
        "pydocstyleEnabled": false,
        "mypyEnabled": false,
        "lintOnTextChange": true,
        "lintOnSave": true,
        "maxNumberOfProblems": 100,
        "pylintCategorySeverity": {
            "convention": "Information",
            "refactor": "Hint",
            "warning": "Warning",
            "error": "Error",
            "fatal": "Error"
        },
        "prospectorPath": "prospector",
        "pylintPath": "pylint",
        "pep8Path": "pep8",
        "flake8Path": "flake8",
        "pydocStylePath": "pydocstyle",
        "mypyPath": "mypy",
        "prospectorArgs": [],
        "pylintArgs": [],
        "pep8Args": [],
        "flake8Args": [],
        "pydocStyleArgs": [],
        "mypyArgs": [],
        "outputWindow": "Python"
    },
    "formatting": {
        "provider": "autopep8",
        "autopep8Path": "autopep8",
        "yapfPath": "yapf",
        "autopep8Args": [],
        "yapfArgs": [],
        "formatOnSave": false,
        "outputWindow": "Python"
    },
    "autoComplete": {
        "extraPaths": []
    },
    "unitTest": {
        "nosetestsEnabled": false,
        "nosetestPath": "nosetests",
        "pyTestEnabled": true,
        "pyTestPath": "py.test",
        "nosetestArgs": [],
        "pyTestArgs": [],
        "unittestEnabled": false,
        "unittestArgs": [
            "-s=./tests",
            "-p=test_*.py"
        ],
        "outputWindow": "Python Test Log"
    },
    "terminal": {
        "executeInFileDir": false,
        "launchArgs": []
    },
    "jupyter": {
        "appendResults": true,
        "defaultKernel": "",
        "startupCode": [
            "%matplotlib inline"
        ]
    }
}
```

data.title: Adding a variable to the watch window momentarily flashes UI
data.body:
_From @mousetraps on October 25, 2016 22:8_

Testing Microsoft/vscode#14341

Initially, the UI displays "not available" before displaying the variable name and result - we may want to consider adding a delay of some sort to make it appear less jarring. 

![724ef48f-8a62-42cd-bcce-647ec737ab5d](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/19706070/dd9c1290-9ac4-11e6-85e6-43004eec1279.GIF)

data.title: Can start two debug configs manually, if the first one is slow to start
data.body: Probably not intentional for this release? But if you start a node attach config with the wrong port, it will spin quietly in the background for 10 seconds, and during that time, you can start a launch config. The run button is not disabled in the debug viewlet until the launch has finished starting up and attaching.

data.title: Option to uninstall only the pack doesn't add much value
data.body:
Testing #14291 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/19707412/4cb22000-9acc-11e6-9ace-5bfeab23f9cf.png)

Instead of the 3 options : "Only", "All", "Cancel"
We should have a simpler message 

> Would you like to uninstall all the extensions in the pack 'extension pack name'?  **Uninstall** **Cancel**

data.title: Handle version mismatch between auto-acquired definition and local package
data.body:
Testing #14328

If I have project A where automatic type acquisition got lodash@4's definition, and in project B I installed lodash@3, now VSCode would use the cached definition of lodash@4 for project B and provide incorrect definition.

In packages under `@types`, `package.json` include a field that specifies which version is compatible with the current definition, like so:

```
  "_from": "@types/lodash@>=4.14.37 <5.0.0",
```

We should read that and only provide intelliSense if it matches against the version in local `package.json`.

data.title: UX: Visual indication for acquiring type definition file
data.body:
While testing #14328

When opening a JS project in VSCode, the types are acquired in the background silently.

To users who know this feature: After typing `var fs = require('fs')`, should they wait for VSCode to download the typings? When would they know VSCode is done and they can enjoy intelliSense?

To users who don't know this feature: intelliSense wouldn't work first but start to work later. Might make them think it's unreliable.

I suggest a visual indication on status bar.

data.title: VS Code should re-open all editors, and keep all the state after restarting VS Code to install/enable a plugin

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code should re-open all the editors, and put back everything in the same exact state after restarting VS Code to finish installing/enabling a plugin

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have an editor open on a certain line
2. Install a plugin, and enable it. VS Code says it needs to restart to enable the plugin
3. Now the editor view is closed.
